title: Zoe has serious design problems
body:
1. She globally gain vision of enemy when they use summoners, that means if you are a jungler and you use smite anywhere she will get vision of you, or if you tp from fog into fog she will still see u.
2. Her E rewards her for missing it.
3. W shards from minions is too RNG depended and won't ever be balamced.

replies.body: I agree with 1 and 3, but I wouldn't say E rewards you for missing.  I think it's intended to be more for cutting off escape paths and such when ganking or fighting in the jung.

I mean, to be fair:

It's a fairly quick skillshot.
It provides decent CC on-hit and is often enough to force a reactionary flash. 
It has extended range through walls.
It increases the damage of the next attack
Has a refunded CD if it hits an enemy
Leaves a trap on the ground.

This skill has so much going for it. It straight-up has like 4 passives.

yeah, but her W was never intended to be a full fledged spell. which is why it's going to be the part of her kit that gets nerfed. her Q and E are her only real spells. her R and W are just for setting up her Q and E.

I haven't played Zoe, but from what I've seen, you get random creep drops pretty frequently, and the effects can be extremely powerful. It's not her bread-and-butter skill, but it's still a "full fledged spell." 

Compared to other champions, it's like her ultimate and W are basically flipped. Her ultimate is a bread-and-butter, low cooldown skill. Her W can have fight/game changing impact, but is effectively on a longer cooldown. 

I agree with Captain Marvelous that her sleep is very overloaded. There's no reason for such a powerful, long range, and relatively fast moving ability to have any effect when it misses.

I would have more sympathy if she completely relied on it to do her job. But even if she totally whiffs the E, she can still chuck out Q's every few seconds, and is bound to eventually hit something with them. At the end of the day, she's a poke champ, and her E (while important) isn't essential to her poke pattern. There is no reason for it be so forgiving.

so you want a longer cooldown? a shorter range? what? the bubble itself is a skillshot, an aoe, and a crowd control that allows another damaging action to deal extra damage. reminds me of ornn's wall.

I don't understand why it turns into AoE zone if it doesn't hit a target initially. My initial instinct is that it shouldn't have this additional effect. It should just be a regular skill shot that whiffs if it whiffs. 

Honestly, I'm totally talking out of my ass rn. I haven't played as her or against her enough to have strong opinions about her overall balance. 

It's just that, in the few games I have played against her, it hasn't seemed like her E is particularly hard to land. And it's very high impact (getting hit with an E as a squishy can mean losing 80-100% of your health bar). 

So, given that it's pretty fast moving, and very high impact, I don't understand why the skillshot needs to do anything if it fails to hit a target. 

But, I definitely should play against her more before I latch onto any opinion super strongly.
What I mean by rewarding you for missing is the fact that her E currently works kinda like Fizz R before  they fixed it. The latch range is bullshit, making it much less punishing.
lol, i have to disagree with you there.... her E is actually one of the most well coordinated hitbox with indicator ive seen (trap form)

the size of it is too large though. If you look at similar bursters like Lux and Syndra when they miss their catch ability the usually can't, well, catch you. Zoe on the other hand denies a significant portion of the map.

that wouldn't be a problem by itself, but since Zoe's burst is up basically all the time (All her abilities have relative short CDs), any time that you mess up and step on it is basically a death sentence. Compare it to Lux, Veigar and Syndra who really on moderate Ult CD to actually burst people and you suddenly got yourself a problem.

For her skill curve, I am certain Zoe will be nerfed in some way. Her bust is too reliable

lol, ur argument is a tiny bit voided in both cases.  Syndra can leae an orb out as a "trap" and e it.  In overall effect it's the same as Zoe's E.     Ur fault for walking on it.    Lux's slow is considerably larger and also deals respectable damage (IK it's not the main catcher, however it provides a large set up for the catcher.)  Much harder to dodge while it's actively moving and is much bigger zone control (lasts longer as well and is AoE)


The main thing that separates them is that Zoe's main damaging abilities are tiny skillshots, and can be minion blocked.  Playstyles also differ by quite a margin.   Zoe's burst combo has a ton of set up and can be relatively easily dodged so is technically less reliable than Syndra and Lux.  However the number of times Zoe is able to do it makes it seem more reliable.   Considering she really only has two reliable damaging abilities (one of which is single target,  the other that can be blocked, it's pretty understandable.

That being said, Zoe likely will receive some small nerfs  likely to the Q,  not a definite yes, but Riot has stated they're monitoring her.

I wasn't stating my previous comment to debate. there is nothing to debate. Zoe's Q is her burst tool but she can also use it to do cheap damage like Lux's E and Syndra's Q.  The difference is Zoe can one shot whenever she lands her E while Syndra and Lux need to land their catch tools and then their ult.

Zoe's bubble is too lenient. Having a 48% win rate on a highly skilled champ like Zoe with an almost 30% play rate is plain evidence of it. I mean Yasuo has a similar win rate but only 10% play rate by contrast and has been out for years now.

They are nerfing the bonus damage on E, and **either** its CD, Its cast time or its AoE when it pops. Probably the scaling on Q will also be nerfed slightly at longer ranges
Except that Zoe's bubble is her 'catch tool'. Also you probably shouldn't be quoting play rates and win rates when the champ is brand new because it skews the data.

> Except that Zoe's bubble is her 'catch tool'.

Yeah that is my point, it shouldn't be so reliable

> Also you probably shouldn't be quoting play rates and win rates when the champ is brand new because it skews the data.

How exactly is the information I showed you missrepresented by the data I quoted? I said a brand new champion that is supposed to be hard to master has a decent enough win rate (similar to that of yasuo who is Riot's eye is balanced) even though she has 2 times more play rate and has been out of about one week? What is "skewed" there exactly?

So basically you're saying that Zoe's only form of damage, that is already blocked by minions and can already be dodged easy because it's not that fast an effect, should have it's unreliable E that helps use it nerfed to make it even harder to use? Between the bubble falling short of what indicator says it will go, getting blocked by minions, being able to move to a position that will block the Q anyway even if it DOES hit, should be nerfed.

Ya. Ok.

Yea I say so given she has a 48% win rate (same as Yasuo) even though she has only been out for a week, is in theory a high skilled champ, and has a 30% play rate- All this indicates she is overtuned and too reliable, even though she needs tons of set up and planning to do a burst combo. Therefore I infer that she is getting too much damage/utility out in situations in which she shouldn't be doing that.

My whole point basically is that even if you say her bubble is not reliable in practice it actually is. The three biggest culprits are situational long ranges using walls (this one is fine IMO), how large the AOE of E2 is and the R+E combo to engage. You are failing to realize that E is also viable as an engage tool for your team even if you don't set a full burst combo yourself
it's skewed because people don't know how to play against her.

> She globally gain vision of enemy when they use summoners, that means if you are a jungler and you use smite anywhere she will get vision of you, or if you tp from fog into fog she will still see u.

No, she doesn't.
She doesn't get vision of you. But she gets vision of the dropped summoner. She can't see your champ, but she knows where your champ is.

She doesn't get vision of the jungler smite actually, unless she had vision of the champ. It also doesn't show up on her map.

Same with TP. If she sees where you TPed to or from, however, she will see the shard.
I didn't think about point 1 before...that just seems... fucked.

That's because he's wrong.

https://www.reddit.com/r/LeagueOfMeta/comments/7fhytf/zoe_getting_vision_on_enemy_jungler_is_broken/
It could be a bug that doesn't happen every game.Something triggers it ,but people dont know what

this is entirely wrong.

she can only see summoner spells _**IF she has vision on them**_
Just another CertainlyT champion

> [{quoted}](name=Swarovsko,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xmlEJyZX,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2017-11-27T01:14:45.233+0000)
>
> Just another CertainlyT champion

I was going to comment this. The guy only makes balance nigthmares.

I don't know what kind of monster Thresh may have been at release, but he has been wonderful for a long time. Darius, Zyra and Kalista are okay (now), Yasuo - I don't know; I rarely see him in the Abyss and when I do, he doesn't usually do too well. I hear lots of complaints about him from Rift side though. Jury is still out on Zoe's case. Hopefully in near future she will be considered "Okay". CertainlyT's champions can become nice additions to League at some point.

Oh, and since I only play ARAM, I throw my ARAM estimates here too: Zyra is strong, Darius is okay, Kalista is one of the weaker ADCs for Abyss. Yasuo is usually poor. Zoe is a mystery (minions probably should not drop non-abyss-related summoners/item actives in Abyss). Of course, any champion can be a nightmare for the enemy team in the right hands.

The designers make the champion, balance team makes sure they're ok. Every CT champ except for Warwick was busted as shit on release because they were super overloaded and the only reason they're fine now is because the balance team is slightly (SLIGHTLY) more competent.
Unpopular opinion... i like his champs, can't way to see his next creation

Minion who will drop shard should be visible for the enemy so you can lane accordingly.

That's too much hidden power in one spell interaction.

It is actually.  There's a little bubble above it.  As well you can see where they are dropped so if she's at all careless you can see where she might want to walk and capitalize on that.  Once you're on her she's as good as dead in my experience.
I keep seeing people mention CertainlyT.  Who is that? Why don't people like them?
He is a designer who, in many people´s eyes, tends to make a lot of overloaded/frustrating champions. He has made champions like Yasuo, Thresh and Darius (I think)
And Zyra, who wasn't really an issue at all.
And Kalista

> [{quoted}](name=Fairyfleur,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xmlEJyZX,comment-id=000e00000000,timestamp=2017-11-27T03:56:46.349+0000)
>
> And Zyra, who wasn't really an issue at all.

Zyra was busted when she first released then was toned down to be a rather reasonable champ.

Heck, the zyra nerf after her release was probably one of the biggest nerfs in a single patch in this game's history.

Basically the most hated designer because he's not afraid to go out there with kit designs.. yeah some of them are annoying like yasuo. But let's focus on the fact the he's coming up with new ideas rather than the usual 3 hit passive or auto attack reset with Max hp damage

> [{quoted}](name=ZoeIsMyBae,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xmlEJyZX,comment-id=000e0001,timestamp=2017-11-27T06:27:06.331+0000)
>
> Basically the most hated designer because he's not afraid to go out there with kit designs.. yeah some of them are annoying like yasuo. But let's focus on the fact the he's coming up with new ideas rather than the usual 3 hit passive or auto attack reset with Max hp damage

This is long, but I need this much to cover and fully explain my stance all in 1 swoop. Bear with me.

I can come up with a similar idea where a champion has 3 flashes, too (here I use 3 flashes as a metaphor that refers to all overloading that this guy does with his champs; like seriously, for example in the case of Zoe, their newest creation, does her E really need to also have damage amplification that doubles the damage taken for asleep targets, having soft reset mechanics when you hit E, to be an AoE trap if you miss, AND having range extension when hitting walls, all at the same fucking time, on top of already being a very good CC spell at the base given it already stuns people for 2 seconds? What is that E meant to be, an ultimate?). Just because it's not done by other designers because they typically have some idea about managing the power budget, doesn't mean the champion with 3 flashes I just came up with is "coming up with new ideas". 

He's a guy who can somehow consistently make mistakes in the most ridiculous way that nobody else would be allowed to attempt even a fraction of what CertainlyT is doing without simply getting sacked or shoved somewhere, and somehow people actually praise and cheer him on for keep making bigger and bigger and often the very same mistakes that others already know to avoid for many various and obvious reasons; how fucked up is that? It is not "not afraid to go out there with kit designs", he's just a bad designer (for this game) with no semblance of balance nor restraint in their design, in a game where balance is crucial given its competitive nature; I use this analogy often, just because I take selfies with a loaded pistol to my head, whereas nobody else is doing it for obvious reason, it doesn't somehow make my actions ingenious on that basis.

It's not even like CertainlyT makes up more creative contributions overall, all of his champs is just 1 gimmick surrounded by a kit that would compliment that gimmick, usually the kit also supports outside of the gimmick that shouldn't go very far, which is exactly the same as all the other champions. The only difference is that CertainlyT's kits often support VASTLY outside of the central gimmick of the champion, or worse having the gimmick to be "do fucking everything", making their designs often doing FAR more than what's considered normal; again, having 0 restraint and respect to the overall of the game does NOT make you anymore creative or integral, but it will show that you just don't give a shit. You know when you're in a group project of any sort, and there will always be this one guy who's just doing their own thing with 0 complying with what the group is actually doing and the bits they've done is always hilariously out of sync with the group and always need to be seriously fixed before it can actually be used? CertainlyT is literally that guy, who can only interpret the notion of creativity and innovation via being vastly different to others for the sake of it and that they just can't hold themselves back from showing just how different and ingenious he is, **in the world full of sheeps!!11!!!** And that's all there is to it, the guy's a fucking showoff. 

There are ways in which one can think outside of the box without beating people with it, Ivern was a good example (only only took 1 fix to put him in line, and he continues to be one of THE most instantly recognisable champs in the game). CertainlyT just doesn't get it and has to use the most obnoxious ways to desperately try and claim that he's different and more creative and blah blah than others. That's not someone who should keep cheering them on for making the same shitty mistakes again and again, we should be telling them in the face that they should actually communicate with the team and operate within the balance of the fucking game he's a part of. What kind of designer is even actually praised for breaking their own game and not respecting their own rules and balance, because we obviously don't endorse this kind of fuckery.......... unless you're called CertainlyT, in which case we praise you for making stupid mistakes, WHAT CREATIVITY AND THINKING OUTSIDE OF THE BOX! Yeah okay.

Also, 3 hit passive was there because of class updates, it has very little to do with other designers and their design.

Full agreement here.  Also a general theme of his champions is because they have massive kits, they have a lot more answers to a given situation than other champions.  While this is often misconstrued as outplaying an opponent, the truth is that it's only an outplay if your opponent has an equal amount of options to come out on top of a situation.  If they don't, then your 'outplay' was nothing more than having access to a solution your opponent did not have.  This is the root cause of the frustration of playing against his champions when you are playing one that follows the established rules of the game.

Innovative designs that change gameplay dynamics without simply giving a champion more solutions for victory - just _different_ solutions - would include Ivern, Bard and Aurelion Sol.  Aurelion Sol is particularly interesting because he forces his opponents to play his game of positioning, but if his opponent positions better than they will beat him.  Good positioning is something available to literally every champion in the game, so this is innovation that is completely fair.

> [{quoted}](name=The Deckowner,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xmlEJyZX,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-11-26T21:12:29.606+0000)
>
> 1. She globally gain vision of enemy when they use summoners, that means if you are a jungler and you use smite anywhere she will get vision of you, or if you tp from fog into fog she will still see u.

https://vignette.wikia.nocookie.net/vsbattles/images/c/c2/Bert.gif/revision/latest?cb=20160922094917

As for 1)- doesn't it also kill the juke potential of Flash? I am not sure with this but I think the Flash pearl is dropped where the player ends, not where they cast Flash, so If I saw it correctly it should tell her where the target flashed to.
it's were it starts im pretty sure

Same with Teleport and other summoners it drops the pearl where they cast the spell from.
I.e you TP top lane it will drop it in top lane. You flash from mid lane to tower, it will be dropped in midlane. 
However the pearl will drop slightly behind where the unit traveled.
I think that the only problem with her E is that it's too easy to be confused for her Q as they're both fast as hell and visually difficult to identify at such speeds.

My primary gripe with her at the moment. Yes she deals a lot of damage, but we can at least say "well she's a burst mage." On the other hand, her E is really confusing at times to notice before it's too late and has many situations where it looks like her Q. Either her E's hitbox is too large, the projectile is too fast, it has too low of a Cooldown, or punishes too hard. The VFX just aren't visible enough to notice for how fast the ability activates and reaches the target location. 

My opinion: moderately lower the duration of her E's stun if you're not inside the hitbox after the initial slow, OR lower the projectile speed and amount of Cooldown she gets back for hitting someone.
THIS. SO MUCH THIS.

She can only see the summoner spells if she had vision of them previously.... If the jg wasn't warded and summoner spells were used she wouldn't be able to tell unless she gains vision of them. It is only after that the spells become visible on the minimap to her.  She can't suddenly see u in fog of war. (have u played as her yet? or watched videos of her being played?)

Her E in no way rewards her for missing it (other than allowing her one tick of her passive).  The E may continue to persist as a trap, but it doesn't reward her for missing it.  An enemy needs to trigger it in order for her to gain a meaningful "reward".  It's a means of zone control.

W, it is agreeable that the shards are quite RNG (both when they appear as well as what spells she'll get)

i agree with all 3. damn, i didnt even know the first thing. Oo

2 is definitely too rewarding  but it seems like she is really in need of this spell.
You didn't know the first thing cause it's not true. If it ever happened to op it's a serious bug

Point 1 is wrong. Entirely wrong. Absolutely, completely wrong.

And point 2 is also wrong. It doesn't "reward" you for missing it. It leaves a zone of effect. You might as well say Karma's R+Q rewards you for missing it.
4. She has a literal one-shot skill assuming you can attain a minimal mastery of her mechanics.
